remarks: Sum of two distinct complex values.  The class expression for ` A ` and ` B ` normally contain free variable ` k ` to index it.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
sumpair.1 $e |- ( ph -> F/_ k D ) $.
sumpair.3 $e |- ( ph -> F/_ k E ) $.
sumupair.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
sumupair.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. W ) $.
sumupair.3 $e |- ( ph -> D e. CC ) $.
sumupair.4 $e |- ( ph -> E e. CC ) $.
sumupair.5 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
sumupair.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k = A ) -> C = D ) $.
sumupair.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k = B ) -> C = E ) $.
sumpair $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. { A , B } C = ( D + E ) ) $.
$d A k $.
$d B k $.
$d k ph $.
